definition: to take and then let out a long deep breath that can be heard, to show that you are disappointed, sad, tired, etc.
to say something with a sigh
to make a long sound like a sigh
a person who hunts wild animals for food or sport; an animal that hunts its food
a person who looks for and collects a particular kind of thing
a fast strong horse used in hunting foxes
a dog used in hunting
a small brush for cleaning your teeth
the act of giving a person or an animal a vaccine in order to protect them against a disease; the fact of having received a vaccine
a serious disease that caused a high temperature, left permanent marks on the skin and often caused death
a small area of something, especially one which is different from the area around it
a small piece of material that is used to cover a hole in something or to make a weak area stronger, or as decoration
a piece of material that you wear over an eye, usually because the eye is damaged
a piece of material that you sew onto clothes as part of a uniform
a piece of material that people can wear on their skin to help them to stop smoking
a small piece of land, especially one used for growing vegetables or fruit
an area that somebody works in, knows well or comes from
a period of time of the type mentioned, usually a difficult or unhappy one
a small piece of code (= instructions that a computer can understand) which can be added to a computer program to improve it or to correct a fault
to be much less good, attractive, etc. than somebody/something else
(in stories) a creature like a small man, who has magic powers and who is usually described as living and working under the ground, especially working with metal
a person who is very short because of the medical condition dwarfism
a change in the shape, appearance or sound of something so that it is strange or not clear
a change in facts, ideas, etc. that makes them no longer correct or true
the father of your husband or wife
the husband of your daughter or son
the wife of your son or daughter
a daughter that your husband or wife has from an earlier marriage or relationship with another person
a son that your husband or wife has from an earlier marriage or relationship with another person
a child that your husband or wife has from an earlier marriage or relationship with another person
the official system used for sending and delivering letters, packages, etc.
letters, packages, etc. that are sent and delivered
messages/a message sent or received on a computer
used in the title of some newspapers
armour (= clothing to protect the body when fighting) made of small metal rings linked together
the posts and rail that you can hold for support when going up or down stairs
to produce a book, list, report, etc. by bringing together different items, articles, songs, etc.; to collect information in order to produce a book, list, etc.
to translate instructions from one computer language into another so that a particular computer can understand them
to cause somebody/something to be in a particular state or condition
to give somebody something, especially in return for something or because it is expected
to present something, especially when it is done officially
to express or perform something
to express something in a different language
to cover a wall with a layer of plaster or cement
to make fat liquid by heating it; to melt something
a hard round seed, like a light brown pea, that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable
a person who shows other people the way to a place, especially somebody employed to show tourists around interesting places
a person who advises you on how to live and behave
a book, magazine, app, etc. that gives you information, help or instructions about something
a book that gives information about a place for travellers or tourists
something that gives you enough information to be able to make a decision about something or form an opinion
a member of an organization (called the Guides or the Girl Scouts) that is similar to the Scouts and that trains girls in practical skills and does a lot of activities with them, for example camping
a system that provides something that the public needs, organized by the government or a private company
an organization or a company that provides something for the public or does something for the government
a business whose work involves doing something for customers but not producing goods; the work that such a business does
the serving of customers in hotels, restaurants, and shops
the work that somebody does for an organization, etc., especially when it continues for a long time or is admired very much
the army, the navy and the air force; the work done by people in them
the use that you can get from a vehicle or machine; the state of being used
an examination of a vehicle or machine followed by any work that is necessary to keep it operating well
the particular skills or help that a person is able to offer
a religious ceremony
a bus, train, etc. that goes regularly to a particular place at a particular time
a place next to a motorway where you can stop for petrol, a meal, the toilets, etc.
an act of hitting the ball in order to start playing; the way that you hit it
a complete set of plates, dishes, etc. that match each other
the state or position of being a servant
the formal giving of an official document, etc. to somebody
completely available for somebody to use or to help somebody
to be useful or helpful
to do something that is helpful/not helpful to somebody
to use somebody/something for a purpose that they were not trained or intended for because there is nobody or nothing else available
an attempt to do something, especially something new or difficult
the son from an earlier marriage or relationship of your stepmother or stepfather
the daughter from an earlier marriage or relationship of your stepmother or stepfather
a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement
an interest in one thing more than others; a special ability
the fact that the results of research or an experiment are not accurate because a particular factor has not been considered when collecting the information
the bias of a piece of cloth is an edge cut diagonally across the threads
an unreasonable dislike of or preference for a person, group, custom, etc., especially when it is based on their race, religion, sex, etc.
without affecting any other legal matter
an idea or opinion that is formed before you have enough information or experience
meat from a pig that has not been cured (= preserved using salt or smoke)
local projects that are given a lot of government money in order to win votes; the money that is used
left at the end of a process
a vehicle with low sides and no roof at the back used, for example, by farmers
a person somebody meets for the first time, for example in a bar, with whom they start a sexual relationship
an improvement
an occasion when somebody/something is collected
the part of a record player or musical instrument that changes electrical signals into sound, or sound into electrical signals
a vehicle’s ability to accelerate (= increase in speed)
mostly; mainly
most obvious or easy to notice
having more power or influence than others
that exists or is very common at a particular time or in a particular place
the money that a government receives from taxes or that an organization, etc. receives from its business
to persuade or trick somebody to go somewhere or to do something by promising them a reward
that can develop into something or be developed in the future
a thing you say or write that mentions somebody/something else; the act of mentioning somebody/something
the act of looking at something for information
a number, word or symbol that shows where something is on a map, or where you can find a piece of information
the act of asking somebody for help or advice
a letter written by somebody who knows you, giving information about your character and abilities, especially to a new employer
a person who agrees to write a reference, for you, for example when you are applying for a job
a note in a book that tells you where a particular piece of information comes from
used to say what you are talking or writing about
to express doubts about whether something is right, honest, etc.
a new or difficult task that tests somebody’s ability and skill
an invitation or a suggestion to somebody that they should enter a competition, fight, etc.
a statement or an action that shows that somebody refuses to accept something and questions whether it is right, legal, etc.
a competition in which people try to win something
a struggle to gain control or power
used to say that one side in a competition is so much stronger or better than the other that it is sure to win easily
a person who can speak two languages equally well
involving the use of skill and the imagination to produce something new or a work of art
having the skill and ability to produce something new, especially a work of art; showing this ability
having excellent qualities or abilities; produced with the help of inspiration
used with nouns, adjectives and adverbs to show how something has been influenced
connected with art or artists
showing a natural skill or pleasure in art, especially being able to paint or draw well
done with skill and imagination; attractive or beautiful
the freedom of artists or writers to change facts in order to make a story, painting, etc. more interesting or beautiful
the ability to think of new and interesting ideas; the fact of showing this ability
a pleasant situation that you imagine but that is unlikely to happen
a product of your imagination
the act of imagining things; a person’s imagination
a type of story that is set in a world, or a version of our world, that does not really exist and involves magic, monsters, etc.
a competition in which you choose players to make your own imaginary team, and score points according to the performance of the real players
to say that something is true although it has not been proved and other people may not believe it
to state that you have done, gained or achieved something
to ask for money from the government or a company because you have a right to it
to demand or ask for something because you believe it is your legal right to own or to have it
to get or take somebody’s attention
to gain, win or achieve something
to cause somebody’s death
having the value zero
having no legal force; not valid
a large piece of metal or leather carried by soldiers in the past to protect the body when fighting
a piece of equipment made from strong plastic, used by the police to protect themselves from angry crowds
a person or thing used to protect somebody/something, especially by forming a barrier
a plate or screen that protects a machine or the person using it from damage or injury
an object in the shape of a shield, given as a prize in a sports competition, etc.
a drawing or model of a shield showing a coat of arms
a police officer’s badge
a flat piece of metal around a keyhole, door handle, or light switch
a shield that has a coat of arms on it
an instrument used in scientific study for making very small things look larger so that you can examine them carefully
if you put something under the microscope you examine or analyse it in great detail
a piece of equipment like a tube in shape, containing lenses, that you look through to make objects that are far away appear larger and nearer
connected with or using a telescope; making things look larger as a telescope does
made of sections that can slide into each other to make the object longer or shorter
extremely small and difficult or impossible to see without a microscope
using a microscope
a fine net of threads made by a spider to catch insects; a single thread of this net (usually used when it is old and covered with dirt)
to help somebody have a fresh, lively state of mind again

a sea creature with a hard shell, a long body divided into sections, eight legs and two large claws (= curved and pointed arms for catching and holding things). Its shell is black but turns bright red when it is boiled.
meat from a lobster, used for food
the form of a noun, a pronoun or an adjective when it is the indirect object of a verb or is connected with the indirect object
the form of a noun, a pronoun or an adjective when it is the subject of a verb
in the form that a noun, a pronoun or an adjective has when it is the direct object of a verb, or connected with the direct object
the special form of a noun, a pronoun or an adjective that is used to show possession or close connection between two things
the way in which words are used in a language
the fact of something being used; how much something is used
a light with a single, very bright beam that can be directed at a particular place or person, especially a performer on the stage
the area of light that is made by a spotlight
attention from newspapers, television and the public
crime that is committed using the internet, for example by stealing somebody’s personal or bank details or by infecting their computer with a virus
a person who writes a blog
something that you think is more important than other things and should be dealt with first
the most important place among various things that have to be done or among a group of people
the right of a vehicle to go before other traffic at a particular place on a road
something that you say or do to greet somebody
a message of good wishes for somebody’s health, happiness, etc.
used during the Christmas period to wish somebody a pleasant holiday
(in Scandinavian stories) a creature that looks like an ugly person. Some trolls are very large and evil, others are small and friendly but like to trick people.
a message to a discussion group on the internet that somebody deliberately sends to make other people angry; a person who sends a message like this

to give a written promise to replace or repair a product free if it goes wrong
to make something certain to happen
to be certain that something will happen
to agree to be legally responsible for something or for doing something, especially for paying back money that somebody else owes if they cannot pay it back themselves
to be certain to have a particular result
the repeated firing of guns; the sound of guns firing
